summary: The Lunar New Year Day Act (H.R. 794) proposes to amend Title 5 of the United States Code to officially establish Lunar New Year Day as a federal holiday. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on January 28, 2025, by Ms. Meng and a number of cosponsors. The bill was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform. The core purpose of the bill is to recognize Lunar New Year Day as a federal holiday.
